org.openimaj.image.processing.threshold

Class OtsuThreshold

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.processing.threshold.OtsuThreshold
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageProcessor<FImage>, Processor<FImage>

    @Reference(type=Article,
           author="Nobuyuki Otsu",
           title="A Threshold Selection Method from Gray-Level Histograms",
           year="1979",
           journal="Systems, Man and Cybernetics, IEEE Transactions on",
           pages={"62","66"},
           number="1",
           volume="9",
           customData={"keywords","Displays;Gaussian distribution;Histograms;Least squares approximation;Marine vehicles;Q measurement;Radar tracking;Sea measurements;Surveillance;Target tracking","doi","10.1109/TSMC.1979.4310076","ISSN","0018-9472"})
public class OtsuThreshold
extends Object
implements ImageProcessor<FImage>
    Otsu's adaptive thresholding algorithm.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
    See Also:
    http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otsu's_method

        Estimate the threshold for the given image.

        the estimated threshold

      • calculateThreshold

        public static float calculateThreshold(float[] data,
                                       int numBins)
        Estimate the threshold for the given data.

        Internally, the data will be min-max normalised before the histogram is built, and the specified number of bins will cover the entire max-min range. The returned threshold will have min added to it to return it to the original range.

        Parameters:
        data - the data
        numBins - the number of histogram bins
        Returns:
        the estimated threshold

      • calculateThresholdAndVariance

        public static FloatFloatPair calculateThresholdAndVariance(float[] data,
                                                           int numBins)
        Estimate the threshold and inter-class variance for the given data.

        Internally, the data will be min-max normalised before the histogram is built, and the specified number of bins will cover the entire max-min range. The returned threshold will have min added to it to return it to the original range.

        Parameters:
        data - the data
        numBins - the number of histogram bins
        Returns:
        the estimated threshold and variance

      • computeThresholdFromHistogram

        public static float computeThresholdFromHistogram(int[] histData,
                                                  int total)
        Estimate the threshold for the given histogram.
        Parameters:
        histData - the histogram
        total - the total number of items in the histogram
        Returns:
        the estimated threshold

        total - the total number of items in the histogram
        Returns:
        the estimated threshold and variance

      • processImage

        public void processImage(FImage image)
        Description copied from interface: ImageProcessor
        Process an image. Implementing classes must alter the image passed in-place or assign the output to the input using Image.internalAssign(Image).
        Specified by:
        processImage in interface ImageProcessor<FImage>
        Parameters:
        image - The image to process in place.
